metadata.siteDescription: The professional portfolio of Asif Rabnawaz, a Computer Science with Cybersecurity graduate from the University of Salford.

personalInfo.name: Asif Rabnawaz
personalInfo.title: BSc (Hons) in Computer Science w/ Cybersecurity

text: Computer Science with Cybersecurity graduate (First-Class Honours) from the University of Salford, with hands-on experience in software development and cybersecurity from academic projects and team collaborations.
Proficient in Python, Java, JavaScript, PHP, and SQL, and skilled in Agile methodologies, secure web application development, and implementing robust cybersecurity measures.

I am eager to apply my technical knowledge and collaborative spirit in a professional software development or cybersecurity role to contribute to impactful projects while continuing my professional learning.

media.alt: A developer's hands typing on a laptop with code visible on the screen, representing software development and cybersecurity.

responsibilities: Delivered exceptional customer service and trained new staff on tills and store operations.
Developed robust problem-solving and teamwork skills in a fast-paced environment.
Addressed customer issues with patience and professionalism.
Led a five-member Agile team to develop a secure Communications Dashboard Web Application.
Managed three iterative sprints and conducted four client demonstrations to ensure timely delivery.
Utilised Microsoft Teams and GitHub for task coordination and version control.
Assisted customers with banking machines, enhancing communication skills by explaining processes clearly.
Improved customer confidence by demonstrating transactions such as paying bills and withdrawing money.

content.title: CollaboCraft – Academic Productivity Platform
description: Engineered a full-stack, web-based academic management platform using an MVC framework to provide students with tools for collaborative note-taking, scheduling, and project management.

Prioritised data integrity and user privacy by implementing robust security features, including granular role-based access control (RBAC) and encrypted user authentication, resulting in positive evaluations for both usability and security.

media.alt: Screenshot of the CollaboCraft dashboard showing project overview.
media.caption: The main dashboard provides a quick overview of ongoing projects and tasks.

media.alt: The real-time collaborative note-taking editor feature.
media.caption: A rich-text editor allows multiple users to collaborate on notes simultaneously.

media.alt: The responsive mobile view of the scheduling feature.
media.caption: The platform is fully responsive, ensuring a seamless experience on mobile devices.

content.title: Hack Camp Secure Communications App
description: Developed a secure internal communications web app featuring real-time data display and drag-and-drop functionality for dynamic content management.
Designed and presented detailed UI prototypes and wireframes in client demonstrations, and strengthened network security through restricted access controls and robust user authentication.

media.alt: Screenshot of the Hack Camp secure communications application.
media.caption: The main interface of the secure communications dashboard.

media.alt: A wireframe of the main user interface presented to clients.
media.caption: Initial UI wireframe used for client demonstrations and feedback sessions.

content.title: Borrow My Charger
description: Designed and developed a user-friendly interface for a conceptual peer-to-peer car charger rental service, focusing on accessibility and secure login functionality.
Integrated a map view for locating available chargers and engineered a script to generate and manage over 1,000 mock user data entries for realistic testing and demonstration.

media.alt: The map interface of Borrow My Charger showing available stations.
media.caption: An interactive map displays all available peer-to-peer charger locations.

media.alt: The details page for a specific car charger rental.
media.caption: Users can view details and book a charger directly from the app.

content.title: Medical Centre Check-in System
description: Designed an efficient user interface for a .NET desktop application, applying Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) fundamentals to streamline the patient experience.
Integrated a QR code scanning system to comply with COVID-19 regulations, which included multi-language support (including Welsh) to enhance accessibility for a diverse user base.

media.alt: The main screen of the Medical Centre Check-in System.
media.caption: The welcome screen of the .NET desktop application for patient check-in.

media.alt: The interface for the integrated QR code scanner.
media.caption: A built-in QR code scanner simplifies the check-in process for patients.

media.alt: The language selection screen, showing English and Welsh options.
media.caption: Accessibility was enhanced with multi-language support, including Welsh.

content.title: Digital Library Item Management
description: Developed a user-friendly desktop application in Java using the BlueJ IDE. The system was designed to achieve specific operational goals for managing digital library items efficiently, demonstrating strong object-oriented programming skills.

media.alt: Screenshot of the Digital Library management application's main window.
media.caption: The main window of the Java-based desktop application for library management.

media.alt: The item search and filtering feature of the Digital Library app.
media.caption: Powerful search and filtering tools help manage library items efficiently.

content.title: Personal Portfolio Website (v1)
description: Built my first personal portfolio from the ground up using only HTML and CSS, focusing on creating a clean, accessible, and visually appealing layout.
Emphasized best practices for modern web development by applying media queries for cross-device responsiveness and using the W3C validator to ensure the code adhered to the latest web standards.

media.alt: Screenshot of the first version of the personal portfolio on a desktop.
media.caption: The clean and visually appealing desktop layout of my first portfolio.

media.alt: The responsive mobile view of the first portfolio.
media.caption: Media queries were used to ensure the site was fully responsive on mobile devices.

items.degree: BSc (Hons) in Computer Science with Cyber Security
notes: Gained expertise in Object-Oriented Programming, Network Security, and various Cybersecurity Tools.
Skilled in Agile methodologies and modern software development practices.

items.degree: BTEC Nationals Extended Diploma in IT
notes: Awarded Most Supportive Student of the year 2019.

sections.title: Contact
sections.content: I'm always open to discussing new projects, creative ideas, or opportunities. Feel free to reach out!
